March 5, 2025

La Habra, California

Where is La Habra, California

La Habra, California is a city in the United States of America. La Habra is located in the Orange County California region. It sits at the northern edge of the county bordering cities in the Los Angles County Area.

How Did La Habra Get it's Name?

La Habra officially got it's name from Mariano Reyes Roldan a farmer who was given a land grant by the Mexican Government in the early 1800's. The area was initially named by Don Gaspar de Portol√°, a Spanish Explorer, who encountered the region when he was making his way up from San Diego into Monterey along the California coast in what would later be known as the portola expedition.

What Does La Habra Mean?

The name "La Habra" means "the opening" or "the pass through the hills" in Spanish. This is in reference to the mountainous geography surrounding it and to it's position between Chino Hills & Puente Hills as a valley between them.

La Habra As A City

La Habra began as a city of 3,000 people in 1925 and has grown to a population of about ~62,000 as of 2024.

Early Economy in La Habra Oil & Avocados

In it's early years La Habra greatly benefited from being rich with citrus fruit and avocados. These fruit where so ubiquitous in the area that it made La Habra one of the top producers for these crops in entire world.

Another factor that contributed to the fast development of La Habra was oil. Oil was discovered, The West Coyote Field. The West Coyote Field active from 1920 all the way to 1994 this oil field was one of the largest known oil fields in the middle of the 20th century.

A More Diversified La Habra Economy

Today the city has a diverse economy with a huge service sector. Currently the largest employers in La Habra are Walmart & CVS.

Richard Nixon A La Habra Local

La Habra is also where Americas 37th President, Richard Milhous Nixon's career got started. In 1938 Richard Nixon opened up his first law office located in the center of La Habra Blvd. Due to safety concerns the building was torn down in 1992 but a plaque honoring his legacy remains where the legal structure once stood.

Despite all the controversy surrounding Richard Nixon their is positive things he did for the American people. One of those things is him signing into law the Social Security Act of 1972. This law which greatly expanded Medicare especially helped people with renal failure which is currently the 9th leading cause of death amongst Americans.

La Habra Was Part of The Largest Electric Railways On The Planet For Decades

Did you know that at one point La Habra was part to the largest electric railway in the world. The Pacific Electric Railway company which got started in the the early 1900's became an important factor in the fast urbanization of Southern California. These all electric passenger carts which connected people from major cities with the more urban and rural populations where a major factor in the rapid development of Southern California. About a 1000 miles of track linked southern california from San Bernadino all the way to Los Angeles. This all eclectic railway was active from 1901 all the way to 1965.
